subject: Self Care
title: Where Boundaries Come From
description: One-minute skill: Where Boundaries Come From.

hook.text: His parents never knocked before entering his room. Twenty years later, he still can't tell anyone when they've crossed a line.

buildup.text: Boundary patterns form in childhood. If your limits were ignored or punished, you learned that having needs was unsafe.

discovery.text: Attachment theory shows that children with respected boundaries develop secure attachment and better adult relationships.

twist.text: You can rewire childhood patterns. Neuroplasticity means the brain adapts. It's harder as an adult but entirely possible.

climax.text: Start small: notice one moment this week when you ignored your own discomfort. That's a boundary waiting to be set.

punchline.text: Boundaries are learned. If you missed the lesson, you can learn it now.

quiz.question: Where do our boundary patterns primarily originate?
options: They form in childhood based on how our limits were treated
